revised_title: Hydrogen-Ion Concentration and Oxidation-Reduction Potential in Marine Eggs
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
tldr: This study investigates the hydrogen-ion concentration and oxidation-reduction potential of marine eggs before and after fertilization and cleavage using microinjection techniques. The researchers found significant changes in these factors during the early stages of egg development, which could have implications for understanding cellular processes and embryo growth.
